intro: Campylospermum vahlianum, commonly known as the Vahliana campylospermum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
